verses.text: \w For|strong="H3605"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w himself|strong="H5315"\w*. \w Bless|strong="H1288"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Lord|strong="H3068"\w*, \w O|strong="H3068"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*: \w O|strong="H3068"\w* \w Lord|strong="H3068"\w* \w my|strong="H3605"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w*, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put \w on|strong="H3068"\w* \w praise|strong="H1288"\w* \w and|strong="H3068"\w* beauty:

\w And|strong="H3068"\w* art clothed \w with|strong="H3068"\w* light \w as|strong="H5315"\w* \w with|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* garment. \w Who|strong="H3605"\w* stretchest \w out|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* heaven \w like|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* pavilion:

\w Who|strong="H3605"\w* coverest \w the|strong="H3605"\w* higher rooms thereof \w with|strong="H3605"\w* water. \w Who|strong="H3605"\w* makest \w the|strong="H3605"\w* clouds thy chariot: \w who|strong="H3605"\w* walkest upon \w the|strong="H3605"\w* wings \w of|strong="H3605"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* winds.
Who makest thy angels spirits: \w and|strong="H7356"\w* thy ministers a burning fire.
Who hast founded \w the|strong="H2318"\w* earth upon its own bases: \w it|strong="H2896"\w* shall not be moved \w for|strong="H2896"\w* ever \w and|strong="H7646"\w* ever.

\w The|strong="H3605"\w* deep \w like|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* garment \w is|strong="H3068"\w* \w its|strong="H3605"\w* clothing: above \w the|strong="H3605"\w* mountains \w shall|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* waters stand.

\w At|strong="H3478"\w* thy rebuke \w they|strong="H1870"\w* \w shall|strong="H1121"\w* flee: \w at|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H3045"\w* voice \w of|strong="H1121"\w* thy thunder \w they|strong="H1870"\w* \w shall|strong="H1121"\w* fear.

\w The|strong="H3068"\w* mountains ascend, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* plains descend into \w the|strong="H3068"\w* place which thou hast founded \w for|strong="H3068"\w* \w them|strong="H3068"\w*.

Thou hast set \w a|strong="H3808"\w* bound which \w they|strong="H3808"\w* \w shall|strong="H3808"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* pass over; \w neither|strong="H3808"\w* \w shall|strong="H3808"\w* \w they|strong="H3808"\w* return \w to|strong="H5769"\w* cover \w the|strong="H3808"\w* earth.

Thou sendest forth springs \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* vales: \w between|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* midst \w of|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* hills \w the|strong="H5921"\w* waters \w shall|strong="H3808"\w* pass.

All \w the|strong="H5921"\w* beasts \w of|strong="H0776"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* field \w shall|strong="H0776"\w* drink: \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w wild|strong="H0776"\w* asses \w shall|strong="H0776"\w* expect \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w their|strong="H5921"\w* thirst.

\w Over|strong="H4480"\w* \w them|strong="H0853"\w* \w the|strong="H0853"\w* birds \w of|strong="H4480"\w* \w the|strong="H0853"\w* air shall dwell: \w from|strong="H4480"\w* \w the|strong="H0853"\w* midst \w of|strong="H4480"\w* \w the|strong="H0853"\w* rocks they shall give forth \w their|strong="H4480"\w* voices.

Thou waterest \w the|strong="H5921"\w* hills \w from|strong="H5921"\w* thy upper rooms: \w the|strong="H5921"\w* earth \w shall|strong="H1121"\w* \w be|strong="H1121"\w* filled \w with|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* fruit \w of|strong="H1121"\w* thy \w works|strong="H5921"\w*:

\w Bringing|strong="H2142"\w* \w forth|strong="H3045"\w* grass \w for|strong="H3588"\w* cattle, \w and|strong="H3045"\w* herb \w for|strong="H3588"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* service \w of|strong="H3045"\w* men. \w That|strong="H3588"\w* thou mayst \w bring|strong="H3045"\w* bread \w out|strong="H3045"\w* \w of|strong="H3045"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w earth|strong="H6083"\w*:

\w And|strong="H3117"\w* \w that|strong="H3117"\w* wine \w may|strong="H6692"\w* cheer \w the|strong="H3117"\w* heart \w of|strong="H3117"\w* \w man|strong="H0582"\w*. \w That|strong="H3117"\w* \w he|strong="H3117"\w* \w may|strong="H6692"\w* make \w the|strong="H3117"\w* face cheerful \w with|strong="H3117"\w* oil: \w and|strong="H3117"\w* \w that|strong="H3117"\w* bread \w may|strong="H6692"\w* strengthen \w manâ€™s|strong="H0582"\w* heart.

\w The|strong="H3588"\w* trees \w of|strong="H7307"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* field \w shall|strong="H3808"\w* \w be|strong="H5750"\w* filled, \w and|strong="H4725"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* cedars \w of|strong="H7307"\w* Libanus \w which|strong="H7307"\w* \w he|strong="H3588"\w* hath planted:

\w There|strong="H5769"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* sparrows \w shall|strong="H1121"\w* make \w their|strong="H3068"\w* nests. \w The|strong="H5921"\w* highest \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w them|strong="H5921"\w* \w is|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* house \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* heron.

\w The|strong="H8104"\w* high hills \w are|strong="H6213"\w* \w a|strong="H8104"\w* refuge \w for|strong="H8104"\w* \w the|strong="H8104"\w* harts, \w the|strong="H8104"\w* rock \w for|strong="H8104"\w* \w the|strong="H8104"\w* irchins.
\w He|strong="H3068"\w* hath \w made|strong="H3559"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* moon \w for|strong="H3605"\w* seasons: \w the|strong="H3605"\w* sun knoweth \w his|strong="H3605"\w* going down.

Thou hast appointed darkness, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w it|strong="H6213"\w* \w is|strong="H3068"\w* night: \w in|strong="H3068"\w* \w it|strong="H6213"\w* \w shall|strong="H3068"\w* \w all|strong="H1697"\w* \w the|strong="H8085"\w* beasts \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H8085"\w* woods go \w about|strong="H1697"\w*:

\w The|strong="H3605"\w* young lions roaring after \w their|strong="H3605"\w* prey, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* seeking \w their|strong="H3605"\w* meat \w from|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w*.

\w The|strong="H3605"\w* sun ariseth, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w they|strong="H3068"\w* \w are|strong="H3068"\w* gathered together: \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w they|strong="H3068"\w* \w shall|strong="H3068"\w* lie \w down|strong="H1288"\w* \w in|strong="H3068"\w* \w their|strong="H3605"\w* dens.
Man shall go forth to his work, and to his labour until the evening.
How great are thy works, O Lord? thou hast made all things in wisdom: the earth is filled with thy riches.
So is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms: there are creeping things without number: Creatures little and great.
There the ships shall go. This sea dragon which thou hast formed to play therein.
All expect of thee that thou give them food in season.
What thou givest to them they shall gather up: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good.
But if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled: thou shalt take away their breath, and they shall fail, and shall return to their dust.
Thou shalt send forth thy spirit, and they shall be created: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.
May the glory of the Lord endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
He looketh upon the earth, and maketh it tremble: he toucheth the mountains, and they smoke.
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
Let my speech be acceptable to him: but I will take delight in the Lord.
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the unjust, so that they be no more: O my soul, bless thou the Lord.
